spanishExample: ¡Mírame! Tengo que hablarte de ese plan.
englishTranslation: Look at me! I have to talk to you about that plan.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
mírame: look at me (Mirar, imperative contraction)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: ¡No lo mires! No puedes mirar así a las personas.
englishTranslation: Don’t look at him! You can’t look at people like that.
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
así: adverb meaning "this way", "that way", "like this", "like that"

spanishExample: ¿De veras te da igual? Nos tienen que dar la cuenta.
englishTranslation: Is it really all the same to you? They have to give us the bill.
vocabIncluded: me da igual: it's all the same to me (idiom)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: ¿Has mirado todo en la casa? Vamos a vivir ahí.
englishTranslation: Have you looked at everything in the house? We’re going to live there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
has: "have", "you have" before a participle (Haber, present, 2nd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: ¿Qué estás mirando? Por eso ya no vives aquí.
englishTranslation: What are you watching? That’s why you don’t live here anymore.
vocabIncluded: vives: live, you live (Vivir, present, 2nd person)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: De veras, él vive cerca y necesito su ayuda.
englishTranslation: Really, he lives nearby and I need his help.
vocabIncluded: cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
necesito: need, I need (Necesitar, present, 1st person)
vive: lives , he/she/it lives (Vivir, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Él vivió aquí por cinco años y ahora ellos viven en un lugar lejos.
englishTranslation: He lived here for five years and now they live in a far away place.
vocabIncluded: lejos: far (adverb often used with de)
viven: live, they live (Vivir, present, 3rd person plural)
vivió: lived, he/she/it lived (Vivir, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: En ese sentido, queremos que viva con nosotros.
englishTranslation: In that sense, we want her to live with us.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
viva: live, he/she/it live (Vivir, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: En primer lugar, ¿por qué me miras así?
englishTranslation: In the first place, why are you looking at me like that?
vocabIncluded: así: adverb meaning "this way", "that way", "like this", "like that"
en primer lugar: in the first place (idiom)
miras: look, you look (Mirar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Eres muy seguro de ti mismo y queremos que vivas aquí.
englishTranslation: You’re very sure of yourself(m) and we want you to live here.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
seguro de sí mismo: sure of oneself (idiom)
vivas: live, you live (Vivir, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Hablaban entre sí y dijeron que fue mi culpa.
englishTranslation: They were talking among themselves and said it was my fault.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Hace siete años vivía en ese país.
englishTranslation: Seven years ago I was living in that country.
vocabIncluded: vivía: lived, I lived (Vivir, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Hacemos todo esto para que ellos nos miren.
englishTranslation: We do all this so that they look at us.
vocabIncluded: miren: look, they look (Mirar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: He vivido ahí, así que sé cómo decir esa palabra.
englishTranslation: I have lived there, so I know how to say that word.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
cómo: adverb meaning "how?" in a question or implied question
he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: La miran porque quieren saber dónde está viviendo ahora.
englishTranslation: They look at her because they want to know where she’s living now.
vocabIncluded: dónde: adverb meaning "where?" in a question or implied question
miran: look, they look (Mirar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Lo miramos así porque yo también viví en ese lugar.
englishTranslation: We’re looking at him like that because I also lived in that place.
vocabIncluded: así: adverb meaning "this way", "that way", "like this", "like that"
miramos: look, we look (Mirar, present, 1st person plural)
viví: lived, I lived (Vivir, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Lo que ellos necesitaban no es lo mismo que ella necesitaba.
englishTranslation: What they needed is not the same as what she needed.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"
necesitaba: needed, he/she/it needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 3rd person)
necesitaban: needed, they needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Mira, vivía ahí hace seis años.
englishTranslation: Look, I was living there six years ago.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
vivía: lived, I lived (Vivir, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Necesitaba eso, pero lo haré cuando él lo mire.
englishTranslation: I needed that, but I’ll do it when he looks at it.
vocabIncluded: haré: "will do/make", "I will do/make" (Hacer, future, 1st person)
mire: look, he/she/it look (Mirar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
necesitaba: needed, I needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Necesitábamos muchas cosas de ese lugar, por eso ahora miro todo.
englishTranslation: We needed a lot of things from that place, that’s why now I look at everything.
vocabIncluded: "de" to mean "of" or "from", especially in terms of origin
miro: look, I look (Mirar, present, 1st person)
necesitábamos: needed, we needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Puede ser… dime lo que necesitas ya que él solo mira.
englishTranslation: Could be… tell me what you need since he is only looking.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
mira: looks, he/she/it looks (Mirar, present, 3rd person)
necesitas: need, you need (Necesitar, present, 2nd person)
ya que: idiom meaning "since" in a logical sense

spanishExample: Queremos que viva aquí y que tú mires eso con ella.
englishTranslation: We want her to live here and you to look at that with her.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
mires: look, you look (Mirar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
viva: live, he/she/it live (Vivir, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Sabes que tienen problemas entre sí.
englishTranslation: You know they have problems among themselves.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Se van a dar cuenta de que ella necesita estar ahí a las cuatro en punto.
englishTranslation: They are going to realize she needs to be there at four o'clock.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
darse cuenta de que: to realize (idiom)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Tenemos buenos recuerdos de ese lugar, necesitamos ir ahí de nuevo.
englishTranslation: We have good memories of that place; we need to go there anew.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
necesitamos: need, we need (Necesitar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Tenemos que hacer de cuenta que no vivimos ahí por cinco años.
englishTranslation: We have to pretend we didn’t live there for five years.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation
vivimos: lived, we lived (Vivir, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Vivimos en una casa nueva y vamos a necesitar muchas cosas.
englishTranslation: We live in a new house and we’re going to need many things.
vocabIncluded: using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
vivimos: live, we live (Vivir, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Vivo lejos y por eso no estaba ahí cuando me necesitabas.
englishTranslation: I live far away and that’s why I wasn’t there when you needed me.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
lejos: far (adverb often used with de)
necesitabas: needed, you needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 2nd person)
vivo: live, I live (Vivir, present, 1st person)
